cards.name: Accorder Paladin
cards.text: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: "I fight for the suns, the surface, and everything in between."

cards.name: Ardent Recruit
cards.text: Metalcraft — Ardent Recruit gets +2/+2 as long as you control three or more artifacts.
cards.flavor: "We lost our homes and our kin. We won't let those rotters take our future as well."

cards.name: Banishment Decree
cards.text: Put target artifact, creature, or enchantment on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"Unworthy of consecration."
—Axsh, lesser cenobite

cards.name: Black Sun's Zenith
cards.text: Put X -1/-1 counters on each creature. Shuffle Black Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"Under the suns, Mirrodin kneels and begs us for perfection."
—Geth, Lord of the Vault

cards.name: Bladed Sentinel
cards.text: {W}: Bladed Sentinel gains vigilance until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The Mirran partisans created hundreds of patrol sentinels to divert Phyrexian assaults from the Tangle.

cards.name: Blightsteel Colossus
cards.text:
Trample, infect, indestructible
If Blightsteel Colossus would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, reveal Blightsteel Colossus and shuffle it into its owner's library instead.

cards.name: Blightwidow
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

cards.name: Blisterstick Shaman
cards.text: When Blisterstick Shaman enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: A productive warren requires a good deal of prodding.

cards.name: Blue Sun's Zenith
cards.text: Target player draws X cards. Shuffle Blue Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"The Origin Query will wait. We must ensure we survive to return to it."
—Pelyus, vedalken ordinar

cards.name: Bonehoard
Brass Squire
cards.text: {T}: Attach target Equipment you control to target creature you control.
cards.flavor:
"I admire it. Few pull off pluck and subservience at the same time."
—Ezuri, renegade leader

cards.name: Burn the Impure
cards.text: Burn the Impure deals 3 damage to target creature. If that creature has infect, Burn the Impure deals 3 damage to that creature's controller.
cards.flavor: Flame doesn't kneel to Phyrexia.

cards.name: Caustic Hound
cards.text: When Caustic Hound dies, each player loses 4 life.
cards.flavor: At first, the Mirrans aimed for its exposed gut. The survivors quickly learned to do otherwise.

cards.name: Choking Fumes
cards.text: Put a -1/-1 counter on each attacking creature.
cards.flavor:
"Fall to your knees and welcome our embrace."
—Qal-Sha, Priest of Norn

cards.name: Concussive Bolt
cards.text:
Concussive Bolt deals 4 damage to target player.
Metalcraft — If you control three or more artifacts, creatures that player controls can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: Shock one, awe the rest.

cards.name: Consecrated Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever an opponent draws a card, you may draw two cards.
cards.flavor: Blessed by the hands of Jin-Gitaxias.

cards.name: Contested War Zone
cards.text:
Whenever a creature deals combat damage to you, that creature's controller gains control of Contested War Zone.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Copper Carapace
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.flavor:
"We will fight as they do: our flesh protected behind metal."
—Tae Aquil, Viridan weaponsmith

cards.name: Core Prowler
cards.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
When Core Prowler dies, proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)

cards.name: Corrupted Conscience
cards.text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature has infect. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
cards.flavor: Karn's creation is now his master.

cards.name: Creeping Corrosion
cards.text: Destroy all artifacts.
cards.flavor:
"We will reveal the futility of their heresy by showing them how fragile their relics are."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

cards.name: Crush
cards.text: Destroy target noncreature artifact.
cards.flavor: A golem's hands know no tenderness.

cards.name: Cryptoplasm
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have Cryptoplasm become a copy of another target creature. If you do, Cryptoplasm gains this ability.
cards.flavor:
"If left in the enemy's shape too long, it might be lost to them."
—Vy Covalt, Neurok agent

cards.name: Darksteel Plate
cards.flavor:
"If there can be no victory, then I will fight forever."
—Koth of the Hammer

cards.name: Decimator Web
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Target opponent loses 2 life, gets a poison counter, then puts the top six cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor: Mycosynth grew unfettered beneath the black lacuna, metastasizing into a matrix of noxious energy.

cards.name: Distant Memories
cards.text: Search your library for a card, exile it, then shuffle your library. Any opponent may have you put that card into your hand. If no player does, you draw three cards.
cards.flavor:
"The fleeting shadows of his primitive self have all but vanished."
—Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

cards.name: Divine Offering
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.
cards.flavor:
"The Phyrexians are vulnerable. Do not despair. We will prevail!"
—Juryan, rebel leader

cards.name: Dross Ripper
cards.text: {2}{B}: Dross Ripper gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Such a creation serves no purpose other than exterminating every one of us."
—Sadra Alic, Neurok strategist

cards.name: Fangren Marauder
cards.text: Whenever an artifact is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may gain 5 life.
cards.flavor:
"The fangren fight without comfort of any kind. We can ask no less of ourselves."
—Tilien, Sylvok partisan

cards.name: Flayer Husk
Flensermite
cards.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Flesh-Eater Imp
cards.text:
Flying
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Sacrifice a creature: Flesh-Eater Imp gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Frantic Salvage
cards.text:
Put any number of target artifact cards from your graveyard on top of your library.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "We will mourn when there is time. For now, we survive."

cards.name: Fuel for the Cause
cards.text: Counter target spell, then proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)
cards.flavor: "Your ideas will be discarded and your will repurposed."

cards.name: Galvanoth
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it's an instant or sorcery card, you may cast it without paying its mana cost.
cards.flavor: It chews open Mirrodin's husk and feeds on the outpouring of energy.

cards.name: Glissa's Courier
cards.text: Mountainwalk
cards.flavor:
"So, the survivors from Oxid Ridge are on the move. Let them come and witness predation in its purest form."
—Glissa

cards.name: Glissa, the Traitor
cards.text:
First strike, deathtouch
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, you may return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Gnathosaur
cards.text: Sacrifice an artifact: Gnathosaur gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Mirran creatures that could withstand the Phyrexian oil found an abundance of crunchy snacks.

cards.name: Go for the Throat
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact creature.
cards.flavor: Having flesh is increasingly a liability on Mirrodin.

cards.name: Goblin Wardriver
cards.text: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor:
"A true warrior fights with whatever's handy."
—Qerk of the Secret Warren

cards.name: Gore Vassal
cards.text: Sacrifice Gore Vassal: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. Then if that creature's toughness is 1 or greater, regenerate it.
cards.flavor:
"Rid them of their unfaithful organs. Bring new hearts to the unbelievers."
—Tome of Machines, verse 1703

cards.name: Green Sun's Zenith
cards.text: Search your library for a green creature card with converted mana cost X or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. Shuffle Green Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
cards.flavor: As the green sun crowned, Phyrexian prophecies glowed on the Tree of Tales.

cards.name: Gruesome Encore
cards.text: Put target creature card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step. If that creature would leave the battlefield, exile it instead of putting it anywhere else.

cards.name: Gust-Skimmer
cards.text: {U}: Gust-Skimmer gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Phyrexian smog clouds choked the skies, threatening creatures who couldn't comprehend the menace below.

cards.name: Hellkite Igniter
cards.text:
Flying, haste
{1}{R}: Hellkite Igniter gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of artifacts you control.
cards.flavor: Its flight sets the sky itself on fire.

cards.name: Hero of Bladehold
cards.text:
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Whenever Hero of Bladehold attacks, put two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield tapped and attacking.

cards.name: Hero of Oxid Ridge
cards.text:
Haste
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Whenever Hero of Oxid Ridge attacks, creatures with power 1 or less can't block this turn.

cards.name: Hexplate Golem
cards.flavor:
"Use everything. Iron, rust, scrap . . .  even the ground must join our cause."
—Ezuri, renegade leader

cards.name: Horrifying Revelation
cards.text: Target player discards a card, then puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Ours is a glorious transmission! Behold a future where all bow to the Father of Machines."
—Isila, Priest of Sheoldred

cards.name: Ichor Wellspring
cards.text: When Ichor Wellspring enters the battlefield or is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Our glorious infection has taken hold."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

cards.name: Inkmoth Nexus
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}: Inkmoth Nexus becomes a 1/1 Blinkmoth artifact creature with flying and infect until end of turn. It's still a land. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

cards.name: Into the Core
cards.text: Exile two target artifacts.
cards.flavor:
"They believe they're driving us back, but we're leading them to their doom."
—Kethek, furnace stoker

cards.name: Kemba's Legion
cards.text:
Vigilance
Kemba's Legion can block an additional creature for each Equipment attached to Kemba's Legion.
cards.flavor: The squabble over succession was quickly replaced by the struggle to survive.

cards.name: Knowledge Pool
cards.text:
Imprint — When Knowledge Pool enters the battlefield, each player exiles the top three cards of his or her library.
Whenever a player casts a spell from his or her hand, that player exiles it. If the player does, he or she may cast another nonland card exiled with Knowledge Pool without paying that card's mana cost.

cards.name: Koth's Courier
cards.text: Forestwalk
cards.flavor: Koth sent partisans into the Tangle to bring survivors to the safe haven of the tunnels below Kuldotha.

cards.name: Kuldotha Flamefiend
cards.text: When Kuldotha Flamefiend enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice an artifact. If you do, Kuldotha Flamefiend deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Kuldotha Ringleader
cards.text:
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Kuldotha Ringleader attacks each turn if able.
cards.flavor: Being surrounded by goblins is less objectionable when they're fighting for you.

cards.name: Lead the Stampede
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal any number of creature cards from among them and put the revealed cards into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Leonin Relic-Warder
cards.text:
When Leonin Relic-Warder enters the battlefield, you may exile target artifact or enchantment.
When Leonin Relic-Warder leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.name: Leonin Skyhunter
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: "The infection has spread farther than we could glimpse from the heights of Taj-Nar."

cards.name: Loxodon Partisan
cards.text: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: "This war is not about loxodon or leonin, Sylvok or Auriok. To defeat these rotters, we must do it together."

cards.name: Lumengrid Gargoyle
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"Anything that watches without sleep and fights without fear is a valuable ally against the Phyrexians."
—Kara Vrist, Neurok agent

cards.name: Magnetic Mine
cards.text: Whenever another artifact is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Magnetic Mine deals 2 damage to that artifact's controller.

cards.name: Massacre Wurm
cards.text:
When Massacre Wurm enters the battlefield, creatures your opponents control get -2/-2 until end of turn.
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, that player loses 2 life.

cards.name: Master's Call
cards.text: Put two 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature tokens onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The need to obey was inscribed on every plate in their bodies.

cards.name: Melira's Keepers
cards.text: Melira's Keepers can't have counters placed on it.
cards.flavor: Her warriors are the last defense against the coming storm.

cards.name: Metallic Mastery
cards.text: Gain control of target artifact until end of turn. Untap that artifact. It gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"All will be reforged in the fires of glory."
—Urabrask the Hidden

cards.name: Mirran Crusader
cards.text: Double strike, protection from black and from green
cards.flavor: A symbol of what Mirrodin once was and hope for what it will be again.

cards.name: Mirran Mettle
cards.text:
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
Metalcraft — That creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn instead if you control three or more artifacts.
cards.flavor: "Our land will not yield to Phyrexian corruption!"

cards.name: Mirran Spy
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may untap target creature.
cards.flavor: Accurate information is a precious commodity in times of war.

cards.name: Mirrorworks
cards.text: Whenever another nontoken artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {2}. If you do, put a token that's a copy of that artifact onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The faces of Geth's corpse-dredgers are disturbingly similar.

cards.name: Mitotic Manipulation
cards.text: Look at the top seven cards of your library. You may put one of those cards onto the battlefield if it has the same name as a permanent. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
cards.flavor:
"They can't even comprehend nature. How could they improve it?"
—Venser

cards.name: Morbid Plunder
cards.text: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Even the dead are raw materials for the Phyrexian vision of perfection.

cards.name: Mortarpod
Myr Sire
cards.text: When Myr Sire dies, put a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: For the Phyrexians, death is not an end, nor a one-time occurrence.

cards.name: Myr Turbine
cards.text:
{T}: Put a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
{T}, Tap five untapped Myr you control: Search your library for a Myr creature card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Myr Welder
cards.text:
Imprint — {T}: Exile target artifact card from a graveyard.
Myr Welder has all activated abilities of all cards exiled with it.
cards.flavor: Memnarch designed some myr to follow the levelers and reaffix lost parts. Mirran partisans put that instinct to good use.

cards.name: Nested Ghoul
cards.text: Whenever a source deals damage to Nested Ghoul, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"The chest cavity is cleared of useless meat. I know just what to do with the space."
—Gyed, Vault Priest

cards.name: Neurok Commando
cards.text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Whenever Neurok Commando deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: "There's no more time for secluded study. Answers are there only for those with the courage to take them."

cards.name: Oculus
cards.text: When Oculus dies, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"In its gaze I saw no mercy, no recognition that I was worthy to exist."
—Kara Vrist, Neurok agent

cards.name: Ogre Resister
cards.flavor: He didn't have a word for "home," but he knew it was something to be defended.

cards.name: Peace Strider
cards.text: When Peace Strider enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"The Vanished must have sent it from beyond to aid us in this struggle."
—Kessla, Sylvok shaman

cards.name: Phyresis
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has infect. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
cards.flavor:
"Perfection is at hand. You have been freed of weakness and made compleat."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

cards.name: Phyrexian Crusader
cards.text:
First strike, protection from red and from white
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

cards.name: Phyrexian Digester
cards.text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
cards.flavor:
"Our cause will ripen in the fertile flesh of the unworthy."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

cards.name: Phyrexian Hydra
cards.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
If damage would be dealt to Phyrexian Hydra, prevent that damage. Put a -1/-1 counter on Phyrexian Hydra for each 1 damage prevented this way.

cards.name: Phyrexian Juggernaut
cards.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Phyrexian Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
cards.flavor: Where nature impedes, Phyrexians overcome.

cards.name: Phyrexian Rager
cards.text: When Phyrexian Rager enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"I believe many worlds will bow to Phyrexia. Mirrodin is merely the first."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

cards.name: Phyrexian Rebirth
cards.text: Destroy all creatures, then put an X/X colorless Horror artifact creature token onto the battlefield, where X is the number of creatures destroyed this way.
cards.flavor: As long as one drop of the oil exists, the joyous work continues.

cards.name: Phyrexian Revoker
cards.text:
As Phyrexian Revoker enters the battlefield, name a nonland card.
Activated abilities of sources with the chosen name can't be activated.
cards.flavor: Basic senses like sight and taste are reserved for those in power.

cards.name: Phyrexian Vatmother
cards.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you get a poison counter.

cards.name: Pierce Strider
cards.text: When Pierce Strider enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"Pain isn't a negative stimulus. Pain is a sign of your imperfection."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

cards.name: Piston Sledge
cards.text:
When Piston Sledge enters the battlefield, attach it to target creature you control.
Equipped creature gets +3/+1.
Equip—Sacrifice an artifact.
cards.flavor: Only the goblins could make a simple machine so complex.

cards.name: Pistus Strike
cards.text: Destroy target creature with flying. Its controller gets a poison counter.
cards.flavor:
"Even a nuisance such as the pistus fly has a purpose in our new world."
—Glissa

cards.name: Plague Myr
cards.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: They watch for a new master, one more sinister than the last.

cards.name: Plaguemaw Beast
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)
cards.flavor: Phyrexia's spiral of consumption grows ever wider and darker.

cards.name: Praetor's Counsel
cards.text: Return all cards from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Praetor's Counsel. You have no maximum hand size for the rest of the game.
cards.flavor: As the Phyrexian contagion corroded Karn's body, the praetors whispered psalms to corrupt his mind.

cards.name: Priests of Norn
cards.text:
Vigilance
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
cards.flavor:
"May our blessings sever the tongues of the forsaken."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

cards.name: Psychosis Crawler
cards.text:
Psychosis Crawler's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
Whenever you draw a card, each opponent loses 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"If that brain can't figure out the secret of the serum, then add more brains."
—Rhmir, Hand of the Augur

cards.name: Quicksilver Geyser
cards.text: Return up to two target nonland permanents to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor:
"Phyrexians are tenacious. That's not the same thing as clever."
—Tezzeret

cards.name: Quilled Slagwurm
cards.flavor: Vorinclex removed its teeth so it wouldn't waste time chewing before moving to the next kill.

cards.name: Rally the Forces
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Drive them back! Make their underworld into their grave!"
—Koth of the Hammer

cards.name: Razorfield Rhino
cards.text: Metalcraft — Razorfield Rhino gets +2/+2 as long as you control three or more artifacts.
cards.flavor: Adapted to tread on razorgrass, the rhino proved adept at treading on Phyrexians as well.

cards.name: Red Sun's Zenith
cards.text: Red Sun's Zenith deals X damage to target creature or player. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead. Shuffle Red Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.

cards.name: Rot Wolf
cards.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Rot Wolf this turn dies, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Rusted Slasher
cards.text: Sacrifice an artifact: Regenerate Rusted Slasher.
cards.flavor:
"It's a beautiful vision. Discarded debris is reborn as a singular entity."
—Urabrask the Hidden

cards.name: Sangromancer
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, you may gain 3 life.
Whenever an opponent discards a card, you may gain 3 life.

cards.name: Scourge Servant
cards.text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
cards.flavor:
"The union of the oil and necrogen has produced many pleasing reactions."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

cards.name: Septic Rats
cards.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Whenever Septic Rats attacks, if defending player is poisoned, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Serum Raker
cards.text:
Flying
When Serum Raker dies, each player discards a card.
cards.flavor: The serum from the blinkmoths they gather greases the joints of witch engines.

cards.name: Shimmer Myr
cards.text:
Flash
You may cast artifact cards as though they had flash.
cards.flavor: It evades Phyrexians by hiding in the spaces between seconds.

cards.name: Shriekhorn
cards.text:
Shriekhorn enters the battlefield with three charge counters on it.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Shriekhorn: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Signal Pest
cards.text:
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Signal Pest can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.
cards.flavor: It leaps from tree to tree, revealing the enemy's positions.

cards.name: Silverskin Armor
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 and is an artifact in addition to its other types.
Equip {2}
cards.flavor: Partisan spies warned that no armor would protect the body from Phyrexian infection. Neurok strategists took that as a challenge.

cards.name: Skinwing
Slagstorm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Slagstorm deals 3 damage to each creature.
• Slagstorm deals 3 damage to each player.
cards.flavor:
"As long as we have the will to fight, we are never without weapons."
—Koth of the Hammer

cards.name: Sphere of the Suns
cards.text:
Sphere of the Suns enters the battlefield tapped and with three charge counters on it.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Sphere of the Suns: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Spin Engine
cards.text: {R}: Target creature can't block Spin Engine this turn.
cards.flavor:
"It will be battle-ready before our strike at Oxid Ridge, and it will guarantee our victory."
—Ketuc of the Helm

cards.name: Spine of Ish Sah
cards.text:
When Spine of Ish Sah enters the battlefield, destroy target permanent.
When Spine of Ish Sah is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Spine of Ish Sah to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Spiraling Duelist
cards.text: Metalcraft — Spiraling Duelist has double strike as long as you control three or more artifacts.
cards.flavor: "I never move the same way twice. Those rotters can't grasp chaos."

cards.name: Spire Serpent
cards.text:
Defender
Metalcraft — As long as you control three or more artifacts, Spire Serpent gets +2/+2 and can attack as though it didn't have defender.
cards.flavor: A mirror to draw its eye, a rod to rouse its rage, and a sword to break its bonds.

cards.name: Spread the Sickness
cards.text: Destroy target creature, then proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)
cards.flavor: Life is ephemeral. Phyrexia is eternal.

cards.name: Steel Sabotage
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target artifact spell.
• Return target artifact to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"You are hopelessly obsolete, my brothers. Come and join the Great Work."
—Rhmir, Hand of the Augur

cards.name: Strandwalker
Sword of Feast and Famine
Tangle Hulk
cards.text: {2}{G}: Regenerate Tangle Hulk.
cards.flavor:
"A true Phyrexian predator. It will never know death, just as nature intended."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

cards.name: Tangle Mantis
cards.text: Trample
cards.flavor: The fiercest hunters in the Tangle don't seek out the mantises. They are the mantises.

cards.name: Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas
cards.text:
+1: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal an artifact card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
−1: Target artifact becomes an artifact creature with base power and toughness 5/5.
−4: Target player loses X life and you gain X life, where X is twice the number of artifacts you control.

cards.name: Thopter Assembly
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control no Thopters other than Thopter Assembly, return Thopter Assembly to its owner's hand and put five 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Thrun, the Last Troll
cards.text:
Thrun, the Last Troll can't be countered.
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate Thrun.
cards.flavor: His crime was silence, and now he suffers it eternally.

cards.name: Tine Shrike
cards.text:
Flying
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
cards.flavor: A new bird of prey—one that hunts sentience.

cards.name: Titan Forge
cards.text:
{3}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Titan Forge.
{T}, Remove three charge counters from Titan Forge: Put a 9/9 colorless Golem artifact creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Training Drone
cards.text: Training Drone can't attack or block unless it's equipped.
cards.flavor:
"Vulshok flail, Viridian shield, loxodon blade . . . Tazzir, bring the Moriok hook and assemble the rookies."
—Vy Covalt, Neurok agent

cards.name: Treasure Mage
cards.text: When Treasure Mage enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 6 or greater, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Turn the Tide
cards.text: Creatures your opponents control get -2/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Let their mindless armies come and face the might of genius."
—Varil, Neurok partisan

cards.name: Unnatural Predation
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Domination by the strongest—that is all that matters in the Tangle now."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

cards.name: Vedalken Anatomist
cards.text: {2}{U}, {T}: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. You may tap or untap that creature.
cards.flavor: "Specimen 211 examination report. Observation: graft sublimation incomplete. Result: death. Prepare specimen 212."

cards.name: Vedalken Infuser
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a charge counter on target artifact.
cards.flavor: "All plans begin as dreams. I intend to awaken them."

cards.name: Victory's Herald
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Victory's Herald attacks, attacking creatures gain flying and lifelink until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The corruption stirred the heavens above, awaking a shining champion.

cards.name: Viridian Claw
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0 and has first strike.
Equip {1}
cards.flavor: "Phyrexians can't corrupt what they can't get close enough to touch."

cards.name: Viridian Corrupter
cards.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
When Viridian Corrupter enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Viridian Emissary
cards.text: When Viridian Emissary dies, you may search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Virulent Wound
cards.text: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. When that creature dies this turn, its controller gets a poison counter.
cards.flavor: Sadly, the extent of Gerkk's healing knowledge was "don't pick at it."

cards.name: Vivisection
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Vivisection, sacrifice a creature.
Draw three cards.
cards.flavor: Phyrexians research with the grace of surgeons and the finesse of butchers.

cards.name: White Sun's Zenith
cards.text: Put X 2/2 white Cat creature tokens onto the battlefield. Shuffle White Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
cards.flavor: After the Battle of Liet Field, the white sun crested above Taj-Nar, bringing hope to all who survived the carnage.
